trans-unit.source: App Model v2.0 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: App Model v2.0 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: An introduction to building apps with both Microsoft Account and Azure Active Directory sign-in.
trans-unit.target: An introduction to building apps with both Microsoft Account and Azure Active Directory sign-in.

trans-unit.source: App model v2.0 preview: Sign-in Microsoft Account & Azure AD users in a single app
trans-unit.target: App model v2.0 preview: Sign-in Microsoft Account & Azure AD users in a single app

trans-unit.source: This information applies to the v2.0 app model public preview.
trans-unit.target: This information applies to the v2.0 app model public preview.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to integrate with the generally available Azure AD service, please refer to the <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory Developer Guide</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to integrate with the generally available Azure AD service, please refer to the <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory Developer Guide</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the past, an app developer who wanted to support both Microsoft accounts and Azure Active Directory was required to integrate with two separate systems.
trans-unit.target: In the past, an app developer who wanted to support both Microsoft accounts and Azure Active Directory was required to integrate with two separate systems.

trans-unit.source: With the v2.0 app model, you can now sign users in with both types of accounts.
trans-unit.target: With the v2.0 app model, you can now sign users in with both types of accounts.

trans-unit.source: One simple integration allows you to reach an audience that spans millions of users with both personal and work/school accounts.
trans-unit.target: One simple integration allows you to reach an audience that spans millions of users with both personal and work/school accounts.

trans-unit.source: Your apps can also consume a <link><linkText>set of Office 365 REST APIs</linkText><title></title></link> using either type of account.
trans-unit.target: Your apps can also consume a <link><linkText>set of Office 365 REST APIs</linkText><title></title></link> using either type of account.

trans-unit.source: Currently, these APIs include Outlook's Mail, Contacts, and Calendars APIs.
trans-unit.target: Currently, these APIs include Outlook's Mail, Contacts, and Calendars APIs.

trans-unit.source: Additional services will be added in the near future.
trans-unit.target: Additional services will be added in the near future.

trans-unit.source: The v2.0 app model is in preview.
trans-unit.target: The v2.0 app model is in preview.

trans-unit.source: During the preview period, we are eager to hear your feedback and experience with the new app model as you try things out.
trans-unit.target: During the preview period, we are eager to hear your feedback and experience with the new app model as you try things out.

trans-unit.source: Based on that feedback, we may make breaking changes in the interest of improving the service.
trans-unit.target: Based on that feedback, we may make breaking changes in the interest of improving the service.

trans-unit.source: You should not release a production app using the v2.0 app model during this period.
trans-unit.target: You should not release a production app using the v2.0 app model during this period.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started
trans-unit.target: Getting Started

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to get your own app up & running with the v2.0 app model. You can choose to send protocol messages directly, using <link><linkText>OAuth 2.0</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Open ID Connect</linkText><title></title></link>. Alternatively you can use our libraries to do the work for you - choose your favorite platform below and get started.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to get your own app up & running with the v2.0 app model. You can choose to send protocol messages directly, using <link><linkText>OAuth 2.0</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Open ID Connect</linkText><title></title></link>. Alternatively you can use our libraries to do the work for you - choose your favorite platform below and get started.

trans-unit.source: What's New
trans-unit.target: What's New

trans-unit.source: Check back here often to learn about future changes to the v2.0 app model public preview.
trans-unit.target: Check back here often to learn about future changes to the v2.0 app model public preview.

trans-unit.source: We'll also tweet about any updates using @AzureAD.
trans-unit.target: We'll also tweet about any updates using @AzureAD.

trans-unit.source: Learn about the <link><linkText>types of apps you can build with app model v2.0</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the <link><linkText>types of apps you can build with app model v2.0</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For developers familiar with Azure Active Directory, you should check out the <link><linkText>updates to our protocols & differences in the v2.0 app model</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For developers familiar with Azure Active Directory, you should check out the <link><linkText>updates to our protocols & differences in the v2.0 app model</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Current <link><linkText>preview limitations, restrictions and constraints</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Current <link><linkText>preview limitations, restrictions and constraints</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Reference
trans-unit.target: Reference

trans-unit.target: These links will be useful for exploring the platform in depth:

trans-unit.source: Get help on Stack Overflow using the <link><linkText>azure-active-directory</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>adal</linkText><title></title></link> tags.
trans-unit.target: Get help on Stack Overflow using the <link><linkText>azure-active-directory</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>adal</linkText><title></title></link> tags.

trans-unit.source: Give us your thoughts on the preview using <link><linkText>User Voice</linkText><title></title></link> - we want to hear them!
trans-unit.target: Give us your thoughts on the preview using <link><linkText>User Voice</linkText><title></title></link> - we want to hear them!

trans-unit.source: Use the phrase "AppModelv2:" in the title of your post so we can find it.
trans-unit.target: Use the phrase "AppModelv2:" in the title of your post so we can find it.
